title: Alcaraz, Nadal, Djokovic & Tsitsipas attend star-studded Laureus Awards
description: When Carlos Alcaraz, Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Stefanos Tsitsipas are all in the same room and it is not at the tennis tournament, you know it is a special occasion. The ATP Tour stars attended the 2025 Laureus World Sports Awards on Monday evening in Madrid.  Photo: Getty Images for Laureus Five-time World Sportsman of the Year recipient Djokovic announced this year's winner, pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis. Alcaraz was also nominated for the award alongside swimmer Leon Marchand, cyclist Tadej Pogacar and Formula One driver Max Verstappen. "When you achieve your childhood dreams, it's an amazing feeling," Djokovic said before naming the winner. "Winning the Laureus Sportsman of the Year is the highest honour you can be blessed with in sport globally, because you're elected and recognised by the greatest athletes in the history of sports, many of whom are present in this room this evening." Nadal, who retired last November, and Alcaraz shared a laugh together on the red carpet. Nadal is a two-time Laureus World Sportsman of the Year and in 2023, Alcaraz received World Breakthrough of the Year recognition. The ATP stars are in town for the Mutua Madrid Open. The main draw begins Tuesday for the women and Wednesday for the men. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Off Court News

Djokovic announces World Sportsman of the Year recipient

April 21, 2025

Getty Images for Laureus

Paula Badosa, Stefanos Tsitsipas, Carlos Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal By ATP Staff

When Carlos Alcaraz, Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic and Stefanos Tsitsipas are all in the same room and it is not at the tennis tournament, you know it is a special occasion.

The ATP Tour stars attended the 2025 Laureus World Sports Awards on Monday evening in Madrid. 


Photo: Getty Images for Laureus
Five-time World Sportsman of the Year recipient Djokovic announced this year's winner, pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis. Alcaraz was also nominated for the award alongside swimmer Leon Marchand, cyclist Tadej Pogacar and Formula One driver Max Verstappen.

"When you achieve your childhood dreams, it's an amazing feeling," Djokovic said before naming the winner. "Winning the Laureus Sportsman of the Year is the highest honour you can be blessed with in sport globally, because you're elected and recognised by the greatest athletes in the history of sports, many of whom are present in this room this evening."

Nadal, who retired last November, and Alcaraz shared a laugh together on the red carpet. Nadal is a two-time Laureus World Sportsman of the Year and in 2023, Alcaraz received World Breakthrough of the Year recognition.

The ATP stars are in town for the Mutua Madrid Open. The main draw begins Tuesday for the women and Wednesday for the men.
